intro: Turritis enneaphyllos, commonly known as the nine-leaf turritis, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its unique inflorescence. The plant features a short, stout stem with a cluster of nine leaves arranged in a whorled pattern, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and white, forming a dense umbel, and it is known for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Turritis enneaphyllos is considered a rare and endangered species.
